headline: Food Isn’t Just Fuel—It’s Safety
body: Your nervous system doesn’t need a plan. It needs protection. Let every bite say: ‘I’ve got you.’
prompt: What food this week could help you feel protected—not just fed?

headline: Every Bite Can Become a Message of Calm
body: It’s not just what you eat—it’s how. Turn meals into medicine by adding rhythm, presence, and a signal of safety.
prompt: What food ritual could you test this week to bring calm into your day—before the food even touches your lips?

headline: When You’re Coming Down, Don’t Climb—Anchor
body: After stress, your job isn’t to fix. It’s to feed the part of you that held on. Slowly. Kindly. Softly.
prompt: What could your next meal say to your nervous system: ‘We made it. Let’s rest now.’?

headline: You Don’t Need Perfect Nutrition—You Need Recovery Nutrition
body: When your energy’s gone, don’t aim for optimal—aim for enough. Warm, rhythmic, simple meals can rebuild your capacity.
prompt: What meal could help you start again—not as punishment, but as nervous system restoration?

headline: Gentle Doesn’t Mean Weak—It Means Wise
body: Healing isn’t in discipline—it’s in rhythm. Choose meals that meet your nervous system, not ones that punish it.
prompt: What’s one simple meal you could return to this week—not to perform, but to feel okay again?

headline: Feed the Part of You That Froze
body: Reentry isn’t a performance. It’s a whisper. Let food be how you speak comfort—not control.
prompt: What soft meal or ritual could help guide you back from shutdown this week?
